A GENERAL INDEX

TO THE

PHILOSOPHICAL TRANSACTIONS,

FROM THE FIRST TO THE END OF
THE SEVENTIETH VOLUME.

BY PAUL HENRY MATY, M.A. F.R.S.
UNDER LIBRARIAN TO THE BRITISH MUSEUM.

LONDON:
PRINTED FOR LOCKYER DAVIS AND PETER ELMISLY,
PRINTERS TO THE ROYAL SOCIETY.

MDCCCLXXXVII
AN

ALPHABETICAL INDEX

OF THE

MATTER

CONTAINED IN THE

PHILOSOPHICAL TRANSACTIONS.

A2
AN ALPHABETICAL INDEX TO THE PHILOSOPHICAL TRANSACTIONS

The first column refers to the Transactions at large, and the other to the Abridgment. The Roman numbers denote the volume, and the Arabic figures the page.

ABC ABD

Abcess. Anatomical observations of an abcess in the liver; a great number of stones in the gall-bag and bilious vessels; an unusual conformation of the emulgents and pelvis; a strange conjunction of both kidneys and a great dilatation of the vena cava — Tyson XII 1035 III 81

Abdomen. An account of the dissection of a bitch whose cornua uteri, being filled with the bones and flesh of a former conception, had, after a second conception, the ova affixed to several parts of the abdomen — XIII 183 II 904

An account of a great quantity of hydatides found in the abdomen — Thorpe XXXI 17

An account of a dropfy in the left ovary of a woman aged 58, cured by a large incision made in the side of the abdomen — Houston XXXIII 8 VII 441

Extract of two uncommon cases of tumours in the abdomen, from a Latin tract published at Strafburg, anno 1728, and intitled Boecleri etc. ad Exteros Medicos Epistolae — Rutty XXXV 562 — 522

Case of a woman who had a foetus in her abdomen for nine years — Bromfield XLI 697 IX 191

A
Case of a large quantity of matter or water contained in cystis's or bags adhering to the peritoneum, and not communicating with the cavity of the abdomen - Graham

An improvement on the practice of tapping, whereby that operation, instead of a relief for symptoms, becomes an absolute cure for an ascites, exemplified in the case of Jane Roman - Warrick

A Method of conveying liquors into the abdomen, during the operation of tapping - Hales

Further accounts of the success of injecting medicated liquors into the abdomen, in the case of an ascites - Warrick

Account of a child being taken out of the abdomen after having lain there upwards of 16 years - Myddleton

A farther account of some experiments of injecting claret, &c., into the abdomen, after tapping - Warrick

Account of an extraordinary steatomatous tumour in the abdomen of a woman - Hanley

Aberration of the light of the fixed stars discovered - Bradley

Theorem of the aberration of the rays of light refracted through a lens on account of the spherical figure - Maskelyne

Phases of the transit of Venus, supposed to be retarded by the aberration of light - Winthorp

On the effect of the aberration of light on the time of a transit of Venus over the sun - Price

Academy of Sciences. Part of a letter, giving an account of the new regulations of the Royal Academy of Sciences at Paris - Geoffrey
